alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 4:39AM CST until February 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Marion and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dunlap, Whitwell, Monteagle, Powells Crossroads, Cartwright, Griffith Creek, Chimneys State Park, Martin Springs, Lone Oak, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, Foster Falls State Park and Fiery Gizzard State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
